text:
This is an AR VR demo that
we did with our customer
in Mexico, Smartlite.
We work with our partners Amdocs

to create the user experience
and end-to-end production.

Technically, our customer in
Amdocs and Smartlite in Mexico
came to us and they were looking
for means to increase their revenue.
And one of the ways that they did was,
Hey, besides just a regular headphone,
I need to use an AR VR application
that will attract more tourism
and get more revenue increase.
So we work with Amdocs as our partner
to come up with an end-to-end solution.
So what is the value add for AWS?

AWS is providing a pre-validated,
end-to-end solution
that is applicable, easily deployable,
and easy to manage.
So this was the value add for our customer
and our customer Smartlite was very happy
with the deployment.
This is some of the referrals
that we got from our customer Smartlite

and this is a multi-vendor
solution that AWS developed
by working with Amdocs and Nokia.

So the end-to-end solution
is basically using
a HoloLens application like this,

where you have the dangle
connected to the stuff

and then over a 5G network
that is provided by Nokia.

So this is the radio
that Nokia is providing
and the 5G code is running on AWS outpost

and that is the AWS
outpost that we are using.

So in that AWS outpost,
we have the 5G code
provided by Athonet.

And then also we have
the AR VR application
that is provided by HoloForge
and basically the whole connection
is over this private 5G network.

In summary, there is a
pre-validated private wireless stack
to send our production time to deployment

and management complexity
was heavily reduced.
It's a predictable course
and it can easily be a scalable solution
that can be used from one to one.
Thank you very much.
